text:
Q: Scrape table from Web to Excel A:

Try this;

Sub Test()
    Dim objHTTP As Object, strURL As String
    Dim HTML As Object, Divs As Object
    Dim r As Long, i As Long
 
    Range("A1:E" & Rows.Count) = ""
 
    Set objHTTP = CreateObject("MSXML2.XMLHTTP")
    strURL = "https://vrbank.com.vn/ru/exchange-rate/"
 
    objHTTP.Open "GET", strURL, False
    objHTTP.send

    Set HTML = CreateObject("HTMLFILE")
    HTML.body.innerHTML = objHTTP.responseText
    
    Set Divs = HTML.getElementsByTagName("div")
        
    For i = 0 To Divs.Length - 1 Step 4
        If Divs(i).ClassName = "cell-tbl-1-2" Then
            r = r + 1
            Cells(r + 1, 1) = Divs(i).InnerText
            Cells(r + 1, 2) = Divs(i + 2).InnerText
            Cells(r + 1, 3) = Divs(i + 3).InnerText
        ElseIf Divs(i).ClassName = "cell-tbl-2 tbl-hd ptop-10" Then
            Cells(r + 1, 4) = Divs(i).InnerText
        End If
    Next
End Sub

Q: How should I avoid "CS0642: Possible mistaken empty statement" in this code segment A:

You can use braces { ... } and no empty statement:
```csharp
void LogicC() { if (conditionA) myObject.ChangeStateA(); else if (conditionB) /*no op*/; // <-- CS0642 else if (conditionC) myObject.ChangeStateB(); }

```

Q: Why am I getting the ImportError ../lib/libgobject-2.0.so.0: undefined symbol: g_uri_ref based on order of import? A:

You can try install the mentioned package, libgobject-2.0.so.0 from here: https://pkgs.org/search/?q=libgobject-2.0.so.0
For Ubuntu:
Step 1: Update the package index:

sudo apt-get update

Step 2: Install libglib2.0-0 deb package:

sudo apt-get install libglib2.0-0
